Docs.summary: Provides classes that allow you to apply a variety of visual effects to images and videos.

remarks.para: Provides classes that allow you to apply a variety of visual effects to images and videos. For example, you can easily fix red-eye, convert an image to grayscale, adjust brightness, adjust saturation, rotate an image, apply a fisheye effect, and much more. The system performs all effects processing on the GPU to obtain maximum performance.

For maximum performance, effects are applied directly to OpenGL textures, so your application must have a valid OpenGL context before it can use the effects APIs. The textures to which you apply effects may be from bitmaps, videos or even the camera. However, there are certain restrictions that textures must meet:
They must be bound to a texture image
They must contain at least one mipmap level

To apply an effect on a texture, call on the and pass in the input texture, its width and height, and the output texture. The input texture must be bound to a texture image (usually done by calling the function). You may provide multiple mipmap levels. If the output texture has not been bound to a texture image, it will be automatically bound by the effect as a and with one mipmap level (0), which will have the same size as the input.
